description: foreshortened figure lying down, with feet, legs, backside and PR arm visible
dimension:
2 1/4 x 3 1/16 in. (5.72 x 7.78 cm) (sheet, irregular)
15 3/4 x 19 3/4 in. (40.01 x 50.17 cm) (outer frame)
medium: Pen and brown ink and wash over black chalk on laid paper
provenance: 'Queen Christina (1626-89), Rome; 'Cardinal Decio Azzolini (1623-89), Rome; 'Prince Livio Odescalchi (1652-1713), Rome. Beardmore Collection. Sale, Christie's, London, July 6, 1976, no. 86, for £190 to Moir; Alfred Moir, Santa Barbara (1976-d. 2010; bequeathed to MIA)
title: Sleeping Boy
